course.title: Poor People's Politics in Latin America
course.description: This course critically examines efforts to organize the poor in Latin America, with a focus on the bases of collective action. It covers early patterns of popular sector organization, such as corporatism and populism, revolutionary movements of the 1960s, contemporary parties, social movements, and transnational advocacy networks, and the persistence of clientelism and populism. Finally, the course examines the causes and consequences Latin America's recent turn to the left.
